subject: Parenting
title: The Strange Situation Experiment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Strange Situation Experiment.

hook.text: A mother leaves a room. The baby is alone with a stranger. How the baby reacts reveals everything.

buildup.text: Mary Ainsworth designed this experiment in the 1970s to classify infant attachment patterns.

discovery.text: She watched what happened when the mother returned â€” not when she left.

twist.text: Some babies ran to mom. Others avoided her. Others clung then pushed away. Each pattern had meaning.

climax.text: This 20-minute test became the gold standard for measuring attachment worldwide.

punchline.text: The reunion tells you more than the separation.

quiz.question: Who designed the Strange Situation experiment?
